title: Nifty: Despite Strong Opening, Resistance At 11,058 Can Divert Directional Move
text:
I find that the looks to reflect the bullish sentiments prevailing in global equity markets, which received a lift after China's central bank said on Friday that it was cutting the amount of cash that banks must hold as reserves; releasing liquidity to shore up a slowing economy dragged down by the Sino-U.S. trade war. Sentiments also improved as Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Friday that the central bank will continue to act "as appropriate" to sustain the economic expansion in the world's biggest economy.

But, broader stock market gains were tempered in the wake of lackluster economic data - U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in August, while earlier on Monday data showed Japan's economy grew at a slower pace than initially estimated in the second quarter. I find that this negative aspect of global news flow may prevail over the positive sentiments of Indian equity markets. On analysis of the , in different time frames, I find that the Nifty looks to be facing stiff resistance at the level of 11058; which may result in the sharp downward move if the European equity indices open in the red. On the other hand, a sustainable move above the level of 11,068 may keep the uptrend in Nifty intact up to next resistance at 11,141.

Finally, I conclude that a sustainable downward move of , below the level of 10,911 will confirm the continuity of further downward moves on September 9th – 10th, 2019. No doubt that if Nifty 50 is not able to hold above the level of 10,863, the steeper downward move may follow the further trend.
